review_title: pay is low for the job
pros: Reasonably decent students to make up for the ones who are their primarily for the financial aid refund
cons:
Your experience will depend on the department. If you are not black be aware that there is significant reverse racism and it can be very in your face. You need to learn to deal with it as most people who work there see nothing wrong with this kind of behavior and the odds of getting justice is low.

There are some very good student and a bunch who are used to getting good grades for breathing (there is some significant faculty split on having to work hard for good grades vs being given good grades for showing up which results in student whining in hopes that you will cave since it works in some classes).

Pay is below the industry average and lower than several of the "white" state schools, significantly lower. Resources for faculty are scarce unless you have a grant.

review_title: More Faculty Centered and Not Equal to Staff
pros: Employee Benefits, Campus Atmosphere, Helpful Colleagues
cons: There are not equal privileges given to staff as it is to faculty with upper management.

pros: Collegial Environment, Great staff, supportive environment
cons: meager researchers, student department connection, research funds

job_title: Clinical Research Coordinator in San Francisco, CA
pros: Close knit community and well received
cons: it takes a while for the departments to respond to any queries

pros: Diversity and a large family
cons: Low payment with benefits that could be bettef

review_title: Only Nepotism & Politics Mattered- Not Employees
pros: JSU provided great benefits in terms of health insurance, great retirement plan, etc.
cons: Nepotism and patronage at its finest. Advancement was never granted based on merit, but who you knew, who you were related to, or in other unethical circumstances (ex: the girls willing to sleep with married men to get a raise). Your skills never mattered. I worked in a department where  the mistresses were rewarded with ridiculous, undeserved raises (10-12 thousand dollars at a time), while the descent employees did all the work and struggled to pay their bills. Very sexist and cut-throat environment. Did I mention women are treated like a piece of meat? No respect and low pay. I was also a student, and nepotism and politics also played a role in a student’s success. Hard work never pays off at JSU.

pros: The expectations are low, so whatever small achievement that you make for doing what would otherwise be considered par for a position of this type, seems above and beyond. It is easy to succeed here, since most people do not have the basic ability of keeping appointments or treating others as thought their time is important. Faculty are welcoming and generally interested in seeing improvements made to the quality of student and work life.
cons: The university is unorganized and pays very little as compared to other positions of this type on a national scale. Students and staff are generally unprepared and unmotivated. The administration makes sweeping decisions with no regard to faculty needs. The administration seems to place the onus of JSU problems on the shoulders of faculty, asking them to teach students who are at an eighth grade level yet do the research of a R1 University.

pros: I enjoy working at Jackson State University because it get a chance to meet people from all of the world an also, you get a chance to help students with their careers and the choices they make. Jackson State University also give employees a chance to grow with education or employment
cons: Since my position is part time and temporary I don't get a chance at some of the things that are offer to full time employees of Jackson State University

review_title: JSU has its good and bad.
pros: For a small university, it has some excellent quality researchers in the Department of Chemistry and Biochemistry. Some of the graduate teaching assistants in this department are awesome!
cons: The faculty and staff can be not so nice at times. The campus needs a better variety of food. John A. Peoples Building needs a major renovation. Get some EFI sockets in here, please!

pros: They included a stipend that I used to pay my tuition for about two years.  The hours were very flexible, and they encouraged me to make time for studying.
cons: At certain times, the job was a little tedious, but it really isn't much to complain about.  My supervisor was great, but the senior management could use some work.

pros: Some freedom to do your job how you want to, as long as you're self-motivated
cons:
Slow paperwork processing
Slow purchase/delivery processing
Direct deposit mistakes; irregular pay dates
Culture of disrespect/non-appreciation of employees and work from top levels to progressively lower levels
Employees in essential offices with little or no knowledge/skills to do their job
Irreverent and unprofessional behavior from employees at all levels and in all areas

review_title: Great company to work for. Good people great atmosphere.. This is a great place great place
pros: you will feel like part of a family, there's great opportunity for any and everyone whether in school or not. Pay is decent people are friendly students are educated. This is a place that the president is increasing the campus and standards of everyone there.
cons: none there's no con's because its a great place. Everything is falling in place

pros: Great experience. I was  allowed to do real research work which really improved my career outlook. I would recommend JSU  to anyone.
cons: The downsides of Jackson State University are that the funding is not enough. If the labs were better funded we would be able to do better research.

review_title: Good place to work and study
pros: Jackson State University is best place to work and learn, especially using studied knowledge for the work. It is easy to  get some professional skill or knowledge from graduate students and professors.  The advantage of working in JSU is that there are many opportunities to share and communicate with difference subject professional people.
cons: The management of JSU has a little bit low efficiency.

review_title: Jackson State is a wonderful place to gain experience as it relates to higher education administration.
pros: Jackson State is a very diverse campus that gives individuals the opportunity to grow professionally.
cons: It is difficult to get employed at the university.

review_title: Awesome. It was an absolutely great learning experience. I had the opportunity to gain much responsibility.
